info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 12:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL BROWN, NORTHERN ADAMS, WESTERN PIKE, SOUTHERN HIGHLAND AND NORTHWESTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM EDT... At 1252 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Sardinia, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Mount Orab, Peebles, Winchester, Marshall, Sardinia, Seaman, Kincaid Springs, Belfast, Cynthiana, Emerald, Mowrystown, Sinking Spring, Poplar Grove, Lake Waynoka, May Hill, Serpent Mound, Locust Grove, Fincastle, State Route 32 at US Route 62 and Berrysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
